title: Government Funding for Jhalanath Khanal Institute of Health Sciences Snake Farm
description:
The case revolves around significant financial irregularities concerning a project to establish a snake venom collection, processing, and production center in Lalbandi Municipality, Sarlahi. The project was spearheaded by the Jhalanath Khanal Institute of Health Sciences, a private foundation named after former Prime Minister Jhalanath Khanal.

In the fiscal year 2019/20, the Madhesh Province government, using a supplementary grant from the federal government, allocated funds for the project. The Commission for the Investigation of Abuse of Authority (CIAA) discovered that government officials had unlawfully partnered with the private foundation. It was alleged that approximately NPR 179.8 million was embezzled, with funds being spent on luxury items such as vehicles and furniture instead of the project's primary objectives.

On October 8, 2023, the CIAA filed a corruption case at the Special Court against seven individuals, including a former provincial minister and officials of the foundation. On June 25, 2024, the Special Court delivered its verdict, convicting five of the accused for corruption and acquitting two others.
unverified_info: The total planned budget for the multi-year project was widely reported to be NPR 720 million (72 crore). However, the formal corruption case filed by the CIAA and the subsequent conviction focused on the misappropriation of approximately NPR 179.8 million (17.98 crore), which was the amount disbursed in the first phase. The full NPR 720 million project did not materialize due to the exposure of the corruption.
key_allegations: Illegal disbursement of government funds to a private foundation with no cost-sharing obligation.
Collusion between government officials and foundation members to misuse state funds.
Submission of falsified documents to the National Planning Commission to fraudulently obtain a supplementary grant.
Embezzlement of state funds by spending them on non-approved, luxurious items rather than the intended project activities.
Causing a financial loss of NPR 179,800,000 to the state treasury.

Ministry of Economic Affairs, Madhesh Province

timeline.title: Initial Funding Agreement Reported
timeline.description: News reports surfaced that the Jhalanath Khanal Foundation was set to receive NPR 720 million from the government for anti-venom production.

timeline.title: Allegations of Misuse Surface
timeline.description: Allegations were published that the foundation was misusing project funds on luxury goods, including a vehicle worth NPR 4.9 million, instead of project-related work.

timeline.title: CIAA Files Corruption Case
timeline.description: The Commission for the Investigation of Abuse of Authority (CIAA) filed a formal corruption case at the Special Court against seven individuals, seeking to recover NPR 179.8 million.

timeline.title: Special Court Delivers Verdict
timeline.description: The Special Court convicted five defendants, including former Madhesh Province minister Bijaya Kumar Yadav, and acquitted two others, former Lalbandi Mayor Man Bahadur Khadka and former ministry secretary Prem Kumar Shrestha.
